intro: Eruca loncholoma, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rocket, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, elongated leaves and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. Its seeds are edible and have a peppery flavor, similar to that of other members of the Brassicaceae family. Eruca loncholoma is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
